item.title: Curated Science Communication
item.description:
It is really difficult for content creators to figure out how to balance creative storytelling and scientific communication. Here are some channels on youtube that I believe are doing a great job at it. Do feel free to contact me and suggest more! Verge Science | The Verge A division of Vox, they do very compelling work and have engaging hosts.
SciShow | Affiliates Science of all kinds.

item.title: Assets for SIAM Advertising
item.description: I have been advertising events hosted by SIAM for several years now as part of my dedication to service to my graduate department at CU Denver. One thing I consistently struggled with was finding high-quality versions of the SIAM logo for use in the posters I was making. I still do not understand why their website assets are consistently ranked as irrelevant on Google image search For the longest time I was pulling images from other people’s websites that Google was scraping more successfully.

item.title: Git & Github
item.description: My Gists on Github are a good place to see what I have found useful to write down for future reference. The use of sines and cosines in programming (or, how to make pretty pictures!) Git (version control) The guide everyone uses to get started Stop Asking for Password: git config --global credential.helper 'cache --timeout 28800' And to forget: git credential-cache exit or, if you’re on OSX: git config --system --unset credential.
